00026 class LWPPObjectFuncs : public LWPPGlobal

00028     LWObjectFuncs *objectFuncs;
00029   public:
00030 
00031     // Acquire on construction
00032     //
00033     LWPPObjectFuncs() : objectFuncs(NULL)
00034     {
00035         if (GLOBAL)
00036         {
00037             objectFuncs = (LWObjectFuncs*)
00038                 GLOBAL(LWOBJECTFUNCS_GLOBAL, GFUSE_ACQUIRE);
00039         }
00040     }
00041 
00042     // Prevent explicit copies - why would anybody want a copy?
00043     //
00044     LWPPObjectFuncs(LWPPObjectFuncs&);
00045     LWPPObjectFuncs & operator =(LWPPObjectFuncs&);
00046 
00047     // Release on destruction
00048     //
00049     ~LWPPObjectFuncs()
00050     {
00051         if (objectFuncs)
00052             GLOBAL(LWOBJECTFUNCS_GLOBAL, GFUSE_RELEASE);
00053     }
00054 
00055     // Check before use
00056     //
00057     virtual bool isValid()
00058     {
00059         return (objectFuncs != NULL);
00060     }
00061     //*****************************************************
00062     // The actual objectFuncs
00063     //*****************************************************
00064     int numObjects()
00065     {
00066         return objectFuncs->numObjects();
00067     }
00068     const char *filename(int obj)
00069     {
00070         if (obj < numObjects())
00071             return objectFuncs->filename(obj);
00072         return NULL;
00073     }
00074     int maxLayers(int obj)
00075     {
00076         if (obj < numObjects())
00077             return objectFuncs->maxLayers(obj);
00078         return 0;
00079     }
00080     int layerExists(int obj, int layer)
00081     {
00082         if (obj < numObjects())
00083             return objectFuncs->layerExists(obj, layer);
00084         return 0;
00085     }
00086     void pivotPoint(int obj, int layer, LWFVector pos)
00087     {
00088         if (obj < numObjects())
00089             objectFuncs->pivotPoint(obj, layer, pos);
00090         else
00091             pos[0] = 0.0, pos[1] = 0.0, pos[2] = 0.0;
00092     }
00093 
00094     // a first pass at a user friendly func, saves little
00095     // but makes the return value into an l-value.
00096     // Compiler won't let me return an array, just have to
00097     // it as a pointer I think ... but I'll leave that.
00098     // Should be a pointer anyway for stack efficiency.
00099     //
00100 //  LWFVector pivotPoint(int obj, int layer)
00101 //  {
00102 //      LWFVector retval;

00107     {

00109             return objectFuncs->layerMesh(obj, layer);
00110         return NULL;

00113     {

00123     {
00124         if (index < numVMaps(id))
00125             return objectFuncs->vmapDim(id, index);
00126         return 0;
00127     }
00128     LWID vmapType(int index)
00129     {
00130         if (index < numVMaps((LWID)0))
00131             return objectFuncs->vmapType(index);
00132         return (LWID)0;
00133     }
00134     const char *layerName(int obj, int layer)
00135     {
00136         if (obj < numObjects() && layerExists(obj, layer))
00137             return objectFuncs->layerName(obj, layer);
00138         return NULL;
00139     }
00140     int layerVis(int obj, int layer)
00141     {
00142         if (obj < numObjects() && layerExists(obj, layer))
00143             return objectFuncs->layerVis(obj, layer);
00144         return NULL;
00145     }

00147     {
